question: Which country houses the headquarters of the Olympic Council of Asia?
explanation: Kuwait houses the headquarters of the Olympic Council of Asia. The Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) is a governing body of sports in Asia, currently with 45 member National Olympic Committees. The current president is Sheikh Fahad Al-Sabah. The headquarters of the OCA is located at Kuwait City, Kuwait. The Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) is responsible for the conduct of the Asian Games.
